item.title: The Dirty Outlaws
item.description: The Dirty Outlaws, also known as Big Ripoff, King of the West and The Desperado, is a 1967 Italian spaghetti western starring Andrea Giordana.

item.title: Sartana in the Valley of Death
item.description: Sartana in the Valley of Death is a 1970 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Roberto Mauri and starring William Berger.

item.title: Have a Good Funeral, My Friend... Sartana Will Pay
item.description: Have a Good Funeral, My Friend... Sartana Will Pay is a 1970 Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo, written by Roberto Gianviti and starring Gianni Garko.

item.title: La taglia è tua... l'uomo l'ammazzo io
item.description: The Reward's Yours... The Man's Mine is a 1969 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Edoardo Mulargia.

item.title: Once Upon a Time in the West
item.description: Once Upon a Time in the West is a 1968 epic Spaghetti Western film co-written and directed by Sergio Leone. It stars Henry Fonda, cast against type, as the villain, Charles Bronson as his nemesis, Claudia Cardinale as a newly widowed homesteader, and Jason Robards as a bandit. The screenplay was written by Sergio Donati and Leone, from a story by Dario Argento, Bernardo Bertolucci and Leone. The widescreen cinematography was by Tonino Delli Colli, and the acclaimed film score was by Ennio Morricone.

item.title: Hey Amigo! A Toast to Your Death
item.description: Hey Amigo! A Toast to Your Death is a 1970 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Paolo Bianchini and starring Wayde Preston.

item.title: Perché uccidi ancora
item.description: Perché uccidi ancora is a 1965 Italian western film adventure directed by José Antonio de la Loma and Edoardo Mulargia.

item.title: Born to Kill
item.description: Born to Kill is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film written, directed and produced by Antonio Mollica, at his directorial debut.

item.title: Escondido
item.description: Escondido ist ein Italowestern aus dem Jahr 1967, den Franco Rossetti inszenierte. Der auch als Die im Staub verrecken aufgeführte Film gelangte am 23. Januar 1969 in deutsche Kinos.

item.title: Der Gefürchtete
item.description: Der Gefürchtete ist ein Italowestern aus der Blütezeit der quantitativen Produktion des Genres, 1970. Regie führte Roberto Mauri; es handelt sich um eine typische Durchschnittsproduktion, die ohne großes Budget auskommen musste und in den Elios-Studios in Rom entstand.
